Definition at line 196 of file scheduler.cpp.

double Scheduler::readDist ( )

This method initialises an array of distances between locations, which are used in a set of tasks. The array is used later in order to minimise the amount of calling DistWrapper. It also computes max distance.

Parameters
none
Returns
maximal distance, which occured in the system This method is used during experiments. It reads the array of distances from the file. It is hard-coded for specific datasets G4S or AAF. Not for public use.
Parameters
none
Returns
maximal distance

This is the main method for a scheduler, which calls the rest

version= 1 - Brian Coltin original work. Mainly for experiments version = 4 - Mine approach filename - if given, some times needed to computation are saved timeout - if given, the SCIP solver will be killed after this time is reached
Returns
if the SCIP finds a solution or not
